name: Florentine Spaghetti Bake
description: This hearty sausage entree will appeal to just about everyone. My daughter serves it often to her hardworking family on their wheat ranch in Montana. —Lorraine Martin, Lincoln, California
recipeIngredient: 1 can (4 ounces) mushroom stems and pieces, drained
1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°. Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, cook sausage and onion, crumbling meat, until sausage is no longer pink. Add garlic; cook 1 minute longer. Drain. Stir in pasta sauce and mushrooms. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and cook until heated through, about 15 minutes.

Drain pasta. Combine the egg with the next 5 ingredients. Spread 1 cup sausage mixture in a greased 13x9-in. baking dish. Top with spaghetti and remaining sausage mixture. Layer with egg mixture and mozzarella cheese.
Cover and bake 45 minutes. Uncover; bake until lightly browned and heated through, about 15 minutes longer. Let stand 15 minutes before cutting.

review.reviewBody: I do a lot of cooking for myself, the wife, my daughter and her husband --and never liked a recipe so much that I felt compelled to write a review. This dish was fabulous! I used a jar of Rao's tomato basil sauce that I had on hand and rinsed the jar with about 1/2 a cup of water and added that to the sauce. I used equal amounts of Italian sausage and 80/20 ground beef to total about a pound. I also cut down the spinach by about 20%. My daughter said I should never make plain old spaghetti again.

I like the fact that Taste of Home recipes are generally flawless. You might not like them, but they’ve been well-tasted, both for the results and the directions. Somebody missed something on this one. Now, I gave it 4 stars because the family thought it was very good and was not hard to make. But the photo is not the result if you follow the directions, and step 2 makes no sense. In step 2, you are supposed to spread half the sauce in the pan, and then top with spaghetti and then the rest of the sausage mixture. It then says to “Layer with the egg mixture and mozzarella”. Layer WHAT?! How is the spaghetti, coated with the sauce, very visible at the top of the dish in the photo?! I just layered the 4 components twice, using half of each item in each layer, that is: sauce, spaghetti, egg/spinach mixture, mozzarella, sauce, spaghetti, egg/spinach mixture, mozzarella. The modifications I made were that I used sweet sausage (I don’t like spicy), used 8 oz of fresh sliced baby portabellas, and added them in when the sausage was almost done. I didn’t drain the skillet before adding the marinara, because fresh mushrooms soak up so much liquid. I used 1 c cottage cheese and 1 c ricotta, as I don’t like cottage cheese on its own in casseroles, and used regular salt because I don’t have or use seasoned.

I made this tonight. I loved it. It was a delicious winner in my book as well. Based on other reviews, I used fresh spinach, and ricotta cheese. I also doubled my sauce, and used 8 oz. Of sautéed fresh mushrooms, as my experience with baked spaghetti is that it can be dry. I used both sausage and hamburger for the meat. Thank you very much Lorraine for submitting this recipe

This was delicious! I modified it slightly, using tomato paste and a little water (plus basil, a teaspoon of sugar, and a little salt with ground beef, onion, garlic, and 8 oz of fresh mushrooms) instead of pasta sauce. I used egg noodles instead of spaghetti. And when I layered it, I put half of the cheese on top of the pasta and the rest on top of the spinach layer. I microwaved it for about 12 minutes to give it a head start on heating the center, then finished it in the oven. (These notes are for me to remember what I did, so I can duplicate the recipe next time.) It's well worth the effort to make it!
My family thought this was ok. It needed more sauce. I used chicken instead of sausage because that is what I had on hand, No mushrooms.
Made this for the family dinner tonight and probably tomorrow too. Was easy to make and came out tasty. I'll make it again for sure!

This is a great recipe.  I use ricotta instead of cottage cheese, like others mentioned.   We also like the use fresh mushrooms instead of canned.  Makes helps with the texture of the dish.  We have made this with a few times and have used several different pastas.  It is great each time.

Hubby and I really enjoyed this. I used macaroni since I had it on hand. I took another reviewer's advice and added about 1 cup of water by rinsing out the pasta sauce jar. It gave it a nice sauciness. So good!
I would like to use fresh spinach as well,but should I cook it first,,even tho it will cook while its baking ?
Really good and easy and comforting on a cold day.  As another reviewer noted, not very spicy, so just add 1/2 cup pizza sauce to the spaghetti sauce and it will perk it right up.
This was really good.  It so hard to get my kids to eat green vegetables!  But this was a winner.  It tasted great.  It made a ton too.  I fed 4 kids and two adults and still had a ton left over.

I had almost all the ingredients for this dish, so I called a few neighbors for a few ingredients and to my happy surprise, one had the cottage cheese and the other had the chopped spinach I needed...This casserole is a keeper!! it was so homey and delicious...I shared some of the casserole with my neighbors and printed the recipe for them...
Good hearty meal.  We used whole wheat spaghetti and substituted chopped fresh kale for the frozen spinach.  Not a very spicy dish, but definitely versatile!

Fantastic! A real crowd pleaser:) I made some tweaks to the recipe as I used 12 ounces of spaghetti  instead of eight (only cook the pasta Until it's just el dente, it's going to cook again when baked) gound turkey ( which I seasoned with salt and pepper) instead of the Italian sausage, one jar sauce plus another half a jar of pasta sauce plus 2 tablespoons of Basil pesto, only half a package of frozen spinach. If you can find real mushrooms on sale I would recommend that.  The cost of this was around $14 and worth it!   You can definitely split this recipe and freeze half of it.  This is definitely a recipe keeper. Thanks a bunch!

Very good!  I used ground beef because that's what I had on hand.  The only change I would make is that next time I will add a bit more sauce--I thought it was just a bit dry and could have used some more moisture.  But, very easy and tasty!
A nice change of pace from the usual baked spaghetti. Got raves from the family. Will be making again.
In the oven for supper tonight! Very tasty and comes together quickly for a fast meal! While it's baking you can sit down and take a break! ??
Nice recipe
Now this is one good cassserole.  Better than lasagna in my opinion!  I plan to try this using ground beef, something we always have on hand.
Made this recipe very good, only change I made is I use ricotta cheese in place of the cottage cheese. Will definitely made again.

This recipe is good and easy!  I cut the recipe in half, used corkscrew pasta because I had an open box; it worked out well.  I also used ricotta instead of cottage cheese.  I will make this again using spicy sausage and some Italian seasonings because the family enjoys spicier dishes.
I made this for my grandchildren and husband and everyone loved it!  The flavor is great and it was easy.  Next time I'll use whole wheat penne pasta.

The title of the recipes in this section is" 9X13" baking dish. is there such a thing?My oblong  glass dishes are 8" X 12"   Not saying there is not such a dish but I have not seen one.    don't think the dishes would be interchangeable with the metal pans.   They are different sizes  and types of material, The glass dishes bake at a faster rate and many recipes say to lower the temp by 25 degrees if using glass.They are not even featuring these in many of the recipes..appear to be square dishes.There is a "9 X 13 " metal pan.  In fact I have an entire Cook Book called the "9 by 13" pan which is fun to read.

video.name: Florentine Spaghetti Bake
video.description: Check out this video for how to make a Florentine Spaghetti Bake
